instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.

threads.title: Macbook Pro <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Powers on only plugged in
threads.message:
Hello, I have Macbook Pro <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that it had an issue with some liquid damage which I fixed but seems that is partially fixed at the end,

The laptop is turning on if is plugged in and running fine.
If is on battery only, is trying to turn on fans are starting but the it goes of befire showing any logo..

If i power on plugged in it stays on, on battery and it also showing the battery percentage... charging etc

Any advice for me where exactly to look?

threads.title: Macbook Pro <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Powers on only plugged in
threads.message: Which area has been affected by liquid and what you've changed/fixed?

threads.title: Macbook Pro <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Powers on only plugged in
threads.message: The area was around smc <RESISTOR>R5085</RESISTOR> replaced and some other tracks . all where done properly, at least I think..

threads.title: Macbook Pro <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Powers on only plugged in
threads.message: ALWAYS reball SMC when detect corrosion close to it...

threads.title: Macbook Pro <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Powers on only plugged in
threads.message: In the case that is doing the same after SMC reball could you tell me where to look? Just in case. Thanks

threads.title: Macbook Pro <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Powers on only plugged in
threads.message:
Hello, I have reball - ed the SMC everything is the same, powers on only if is plugged in, battery indicator is not showing noting, sometimes  is turning on if I try few times unplugged.

The battery is good and if I turn on is showing the percentage ok and the macbook is running fine.

Any help?

threads.title: Macbook Pro <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Powers on only plugged in
threads.message:
Check resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28 of <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>.
Also check <SIGNAL>CHGR_A</SIGNAL>/BMON levels, w/ and w/o battery connected.

Run HWMonitor and see if reports any strange voltage, or current sensor.
